intro: Othocallis amoena, commonly known as the pretty spurge, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with unique floral structures. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow in color. It is characterized by its succulent leaves and stems, which help it retain moisture in arid environments. Othocallis amoena is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and low maintenance requirements.
